page.title: 05A VISIT TO HORTON COURT
page.content: On Wednesday we went to Horton Court which belongs to the National Trust.The National Trust is a society of people who are given money to preserve and restore old buildings.We went into the Norman Hall and we saw a bearskin rug in front of a big fire place.We were shown a long table which was just one piece of wood standing on four very short legs.On the table were six pewter plates with patterns on them.On another table was some armour which dated from Oliver Cromwell's time. Then we went outside and saw the ambulatory where ladies used to walk up and down when it rained.We then walked down to the rose garden where we met two people who had come from Newcastle.They said they loved looking at interesting places and were going on to Cirencester.Alex,James,Katherine
